I'll end with this:
To find out who rules over you, simply find out who you are not allowed to criticize.
 --Voltaire

> [00d4n1](#comment_1_1Mr36Z4TSbWQ236NfvRPeLn3qsAwngBzMd): You can't debate fascists in a respectful manner - they're not arguing in good faith and will not be convinced by reason. Allowing literal Nazis to air their evil on your general-purpose discussion board is feeding them, certainly far more so than not allowing such would be. It's letting their views spread and perpetuate, it's letting them gain momentum, and all the while it's alienating good people who just aren't safe in a community with no practical way to escape fascist contributors.

I don't believe in censoring any opinions, no matter how much one must dislike it. Because ultimately you're not stopping their opinion. You're masquerading it. Just because you can't read it doesn't mean they don't have it. If they are undermined for a prolonged time they will eventually surface and explode in rage.

Just look to Europe. It is no longer allowed to criticize muslims. Their opinion is censored everywhere. There is no airwave where people can express their opinion on muslims. There is no newspaper where one can express their opinion of muslims. The public sector and the media overall is an echo chamber. These people have no contact with the common man. These people don't even realize that people dislike the immigration policies. They don't get it because they never hear or read about it.

THAT is why fascist raise to power. Because people are still frustrated and people still talk. And they are mad as hell (and they're not gonna take it anymore). And when they are not taken seriously, they vote for Le Pen, they vote for AfD, they vote for Sweden democrats, they vote for Brexit and they vote for Trump.

The world is going to burn in a few years, and it is because of people like you who want to undermine people all the time. You are "forbidding" them certain thoughts. You are insulting them. Call them unintelligent. You call them deplorable. You are bullying them. All the while you are sitting on your high-horse, but you are no better than they are. You are just different.

Letting them go unchallenged is the problem. You should be welcoming them. I'm not particularly talking about zeronet here. I'm talking in general. Even on national TV.

> [00d4n1](#comment_8_1Mr36Z4TSbWQ236NfvRPeLn3qsAwngBzMd): 
> Let me put it this way: genocide isn't a matter of opinion. It's bad, and that's not up for debate. It's objectively a bad thing that should not be done or advocated.

Let me put it this way. I'm not a fucking idiot. The point is, it's my opinion that no opinion is better to be censored. Its universally better to deal with the opnion rather than removing it from its existence. What else should be censored? It's called slippery-slope. And we simply do not get on that "what is it OK to censor and what is not". Nothing, nothing, is OK to censor. That's my stand.

Ok. So here is the disclaimer. The owner of a website determine what goes and what doesn't. I'm perfectly fine with it. It's not our right to have outrages comments published in the news paper or the comment section. But, under no cercomstance should it be illegal to say something no matter what it might be.

> [00d4n1](#comment_10_1Mr36Z4TSbWQ236NfvRPeLn3qsAwngBzMd): Genocide isn't an opinion. Opinions are subjective, and people are free to have differing opinions and to talk about them. Genocide is objectively evil, and anyone claiming otherwise is objectively wrong.

Just to be clear. The act of genocide is not an opinion. Advocating genocide is, per definition, a legitimate opinion. However, it's also outrageous. And yes, I agree that it is objectively wrong and objectively evil. I understand you 100%.

However, the reason I'm critical is this. Just like you're on a mission to "remove" hatred, I'm on a mission to support freedom of speech, no matter what the opinions might be. That's one of the reasons why I'm running this zeronet node. The whole emergence of "fake news" motivates me even more, since governments are seriously discussing to remove "fake news" from existence. (E.g. implementing ministry of truth).

I don't know where you are from, but in Europe people have a growing frustration with the established parties, most of which agree on increasing imigration of people from countries we are at (proxy) war with. This has led to the uprising of "extremist" parties. And at least two-three countries have tried to silence them using the slippery-slope of anti-semetism. Their logic is that in the 1930 and 1940 people expressed their hatred of jews which lead to genocide. Since people are now expressing hatred of muslims, this too will lead to genocide. This is obviously a logical fallacy.

Some people in these "extremist" parties are obviously way across the line, but most people are decent people. I can't recall any having argued for genocide of muslims. People simply want the immigration to stop. Now, Europe wouldn't be in this situation in the first place if people were actually allowed to state their opinion, but they aren't. Just arguing of a tightening in the policy will get them labelled as "racist", even though they are not. They will be bullied and assaulted physically and verbally. However, this is NOT considered hate-crime, so usually there is no consequence of assaulting these people. In fact, stating their opinion was the act of hate.

This is also occurring in the US. People have almost been murdered just for voting for Trump and the justification for the violence was that the person was a racist. This is insane.

This polarizing is, in my un-humble opinion, the direct result of people being censored. The discussions have to be made, or the problem will get exponentially worse. The more immigrants that come the more people will "cross over", and the more traction these extremists get. This is what we get when elected officials stop listening to people, and are not hearing their voice because people might be offended if they hear something they don't like.

10_1EZTWytasXcKdiUFnN4KHqAfvg1nwkTkKv.body:
I disagree. Ultimately it will need a "killer-app". It will possibly gain in popularity with these things in place, but the optimum thing would be to make it mainstream. People in general don't really care about censorship. If they continue this crusade against "fake news", then maybe zeronet could become sort of a publishing platform. People could be lured in that way.

Another way would be to get the torrent search working. Many countries have started to block access to torrent search web sites. Getting a working torrent search on zeronet would also be a way of making it mainstream.

But these functions are all for nothing if zeronet is not advertised anywhere. People need to hear about it to start using it. So the zeronet team need to contact torrentfreak and have them write articles about it, and alternative news publishers to advertise where they can be found, etc.

Finally, a working public gateway could also be helpful. Then people could start using it, before they decided they would want to run their own node.
